intro: Orbea chrysostephana, commonly known as the golden-stephan orbea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Orbea chrysostephana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience.
